intro: Cryptantha jonesii, commonly known as Jones' cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or pink. The plant grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy stems and small, ovate leaves. Cryptantha jonesii is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
